data.value: This window optimizes for the narrowest main lobe width for a given order
, using Chebyshev polynomials.  It was originally developed by Dolph to optimize the directionality of radio antenna arrays.
Unlike most windows, the Dolph-Chebyshev is defined in terms of its frequency response:
and 0 <= abs(k) <= M-1. A is the attenuation in decibels (
The time domain window is then generated using the IFFT, so power-of-two
are the fastest to generate, and prime number
The equiripple condition in the frequency domain creates impulses in the time domain, which appear at the ends of the window.
Number of points in the output window. If zero or less, an empty array is returned.
When True (default), generates a symmetric window, for use in filter design. When False, generates a periodic window, for use in spectral analysis.
The window, with the maximum value always normalized to 1
